posts._title: Nobuhiko Ôbayashi – Ijin-tachi to no natsu AKA The Discarnates AKA Summer Among the Zombies (1988)
posts.title: Ijin-tachi to no natsu
posts.excerpt: Harada is a successful scenario writer, and his best buddy has just announced an intention to propose to Harada’s ex-wife. Recovering from the shock, Harada indulges in melancholy, mainly on his failure as a husband and father, and goes to a ‘Rakugo’ (sit-down comedy) show, where a friendly man in the audience invites him home. …
posts.titleEnglish: The Discarnates AKA Summer Among the Zombies

posts.title: Le Tonnelier
posts.excerpt: A short documentary about the life and craft of a French cooper. The main focus is on the two-day process of creating a wine barrel, from nada to completion. Interspersed throughout are little snippets concerning the life of the cooper whose work we follow, like mentioning his daughter’s marriage and his being involved in WWI.

posts._title: Berit Nesheim – Søndagsengler AKA The Other Side of Sunday (1996)
posts.title: Søndagsengler
posts.excerpt: Synopsis wrote:The Other Side of Sunday, also known in Norwegian as “Søndagsengler”, is a movie that criticizes the small, and often tight, church community. We follow the Preacher’s Daughter, Maria, on her journey to liberate herself from the stiff church community and her father.

posts._title: Luis Alcoriza – Mecanica Nacional AKA National Mechanics (1972)
posts.title: Mecanica Nacional
posts.excerpt: This is a satirical look at Mexican contemporary life. It makes fun of its culture in many ways. Even though it has many dramatic and serious moments, it’s a very effective comedy.The movie is simply about two families from Mexico City that go camping to the mountains outside the city overnight to see the conclusion …

posts.title: Arirang
posts.excerpt: Korean filmmaker Kim Ki-duk bares his tortured, inebriated soul in “Arirang,” and it’s not a pretty sight. An experience that can be likened only to being stuck next to a drunk in a bar who keeps reminding you he used to be famous, all his friends are bastards and he now understands the meaning of …

posts._title: Ani Simon-Kennedy – The Short History of the Long Road (2019)
posts.title: The Short History of the Long Road
posts.excerpt: Quote:A teenager has to confront the reality of life on the road after tragedy strikes.

posts.title: Colectiv
posts.excerpt: SynopsisDirector Alexander Nanau follows a crack team of investigators at the Romanian newspaper Gazeta Sporturilor as they try to uncover a vast health-care fraud that enriched moguls and politicians and led to the deaths of innocent citizens.

posts._title: Christian Schwochow – Deutschstunde AKA The German Lesson (2019)
posts.title: Deutschstunde
posts.excerpt: An atmospheric adaptation of Siegfried Lenz’s timeless world bestseller.

posts._title: Marguerite Duras – Il Dialogo di Roma (1982)
posts.title: Il Dialogo di Roma
posts.excerpt: A man and a woman in Rome evoke a civilization and an ancient love.

posts._title: Melisa Önel – Kumun Tadi AKA Seaburners (2014)
posts.title: Kumun Tadi
posts.excerpt: A harsh wintery scene on the Turkish Black Sea coast. Denise, a foreign botanist, has ended up here for research purposes. She stoically trudges through water knee-deep to get to the remote site where she cultivates her plants. With the same resolve and fearlessness, she also makes her way through the night to the secluded …
